report_title: Optical Character Recognition Software Industry Report
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2022 currency. The Optical Character Recognition Software industry produces the software needed to convert texts on physical documents into digital file formats. Over the five years to 2022, industry revenue is projected to increase at an annualized rate of 4.6% to $2.5 billion, including a decline of 0.7% in 2022 as the percentage of business conducted online is expected to decline following a surge resulting from the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Expenditure on R&D has boosted industry revenue, it has also mitigated significant profit growth during the period. Moreover, competition has risen alongside technological developments, particularly from open-source software developers that produce OCR software at no charge to the end user.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: IBISWorld anticipates the healthcare sector will play a leading role in generating demand for optical character-recognition (OCR) software over the next five years. The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic in 2020 accelerated the trend toward digitalization in the healthcare industry, as speeding up business processes, storing data online and even coronavirus contact tracing became critical to the industry's success.

Improving technology and falling hardware prices will continue bringing more of the digital world to the masses. Operators are expected to increasingly utilize machine learning to develop OCR software, which will continue expanding the capabilities and types of OCR. Moreover, industry operators are expected to turn toward deep learning, which is a subset of machine learning, to create OCR software that derives meaning from text rather than simply digitizing it.

As technology improves the accuracy and capabilities of OCR software, competition is expected to rise among industry operators. The industry is already highly fragmented, with the top three operators accounting for just 8.7% of industry revenue. Thus, consolidation has yet to significantly stifle smaller industry operators.

industry_definition: This industry develops optical character recognition software, which electronically translates scanned images of handwritten, typewritten or printed text into machine-encoded text. It is widely used to convert books and documents into electronic files, to computerize a record-keeping system in an office or to publish the text on a website.
key_trends: Emerging technologies have expanded capabilities and greatly increased the accuracy of OCR software
The coronavirus pandemic in 2020 fueled the transition toward conducting business online for consumers and businesses that were yet to fully embrace digitalization
Rising demand and strong profit has encouraged the entrance of new developers that aim to capitalize on growing segments such as mobile and healthcare
Operators will benefit from an increase in private investment in computers and software
IBISWorld anticipates the healthcare sector will play a leading role in generating demand for OCR software over the next five years
As technology improves the accuracy and capabilities of OCR software, competition is expected to rise among industry operators
Machine learning and artificial intelligence have expanded the capabilities of OCR software and increased its accuracy during the period

market_segmentation.segment_description: The finance and insurance market includes operators that provide financial services such as banks and investment firms, as well as insurance companies. Over the past five years to 2022, this segment has increased as a share of revenue, accounting for 32.5% of Optical Character Recognition Software industry revenue in 2022.
The legal sector is the second-largest market for industry products, accounting for an estimated 26.0% of industry revenue in 2022.

The healthcare sector has been a fast-growing market segment for the industry. Paper-heavy, operators in this sector are increasingly moving patient records to digital formats to increase the ease of access from remote locations.
Within the government and public establishments segment, OCR software is used by federal and state regulatory bodies, libraries, transportation providers and educational institutions.
The consumer market has also grown substantially over the past five years. Recently, OCR software developers have started developing mobile image recognition applications.
Other clients include companies in the software development industry, photography and peripheral hardware development.

products_and_services.product_description: Corporate OCR software enables customers to compare documents and automate conversion, increasing efficiency.
Standard OCR software products account for an estimated 31.8% of revenue.
Personal-use products are purchased by individuals to use at home or on-the-go via mobile applications.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for optical character recognition (OCR) software is determined by the amount of information and the percentage of business conducted online.
Price is also becoming a demand determinant for some OCR software services.

international_trade_points.trade_description: International trade is not classified within the Optical Character Recognition Software industry.

business_locations.location_description: The West region accounts for 22.6% of the industry's establishment concentration.
The Mid-Atlantic region also represents an area of high concentration for the industry.
The Southeast region accounts for an estimated 17.6% of industry establishments.
The Great Lakes region also holds a significant portion of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Operators in the industry are not subjected to any technology-specific regulations.
Since software can be distributed through the internet, international intellectual property laws are also of significance to the industry.
In response to CDC guidance, various levels of regulation were implemented to discourage public gatherings due to the coronavirus pandemic.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Potential entrants may have difficulty sourcing talent for product development.
Competition among industry participants is also of significance.
Competition from free and open-source software is also intensifying.

basis_points.basis_description: Players in the Optical Character Recognition Software industry compete on the basis of recognition accuracy.
Players compete on the availability of languages their software can recognize.
Speed of recognition is a basis of competition in the industry.
Availability of output file formats is a competitive factor.
Accessibility and user interface are bases of competition.
Price is a competitive factor only across products that are similar in function.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages represent the largest expense category for the Optical Character Recognition Software industry, accounting for 36.2% of revenue in 2022.
Purchases for software developers are low.
Depreciation costs for the industry are low.
The typical OCR software developer does not spend a significant amount on marketing.
On average, rent expenditures account for a small fraction of revenue.
Utilities costs are relatively minimal in this industry.
A large portion of operators' expenditure is allocated to research and development costs.
